headline: Keto Chicken Cordon Bleu Meatballs
description: These keto chicken Cordon Bleu meatballs are ham-stuffed chicken meatballs topped with a creamy Swiss cheese sauce. Simple and delicious!
name: Keto Chicken Cordon Bleu Meatballs
recipeIngredient: 6 ounces ham steak, cubed into 20 even pieces
1 pinch cracked black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chicken, almond flour, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and egg in a bowl. Form a small portion of chicken mixture into a 1 1/2-inch ball around a cube of ham; place on a plate. Repeat with remaining chicken mixture and ham, making 20 meatballs total.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown meatballs for 3 minutes on one side; turn and cook an additional 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer meatballs onto a clean plate.

Return the skillet to medium heat and melt butter. Whisk in chicken broth and Dijon mustard; bring to a simmer for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in heavy cream and whisk until sauce begins to simmer. Whisk in Swiss cheese until completely melted. Return meatballs to skillet and simmer until sauce has slightly thickened, 3 to 4 minutes. Season with cracked black pepper and parsley. Serve immediately. Sauce will further thicken upon cooling.

review.reviewBody: I made it exactly as the recipe called for. It was very good. I would double the sauce though as there was not enough to go around. I sprinkled more grated Swiss cheese on top of the meatballs before serving them. For those that like a little more spicey heat, it is easy to add more spices before forming the meatballs.
Had this tonight for dinner. The family loved it, I will definitely make it again!
So good! Added some almond flour to the sauce and butter to make it thicker and used chicken bouillon instead of broth for more of a flavor pop and it was a hit!

I made the recipe just as written except I didn't have ham steak but ham slices. I chopped it up and added it to the meatballs. It was delicious. I cooked the sauce for a while while I made cauliflower gnocchi and it thickened up nicely. Definitely a keeper!

I thought this was delicious! But let me be clear, I DID NOT MAKE THIS "KETO STYLE", I was drawn to this NOT for the keto but because it sounded good. I used ground turkey (generally when i make any type of meatball i do a 50/50 mix of turkey/beef, I did NOT do that this time but will next time..the turkey alone was too much for the hubby.) I used (homemade) bread crumbs in place of almond flour (kept adding until i found the consistency i like, approx 1c). I also cooked these in some broth in the bottom of the pan. And because i read some of the reviews that said the sauce was too thin, i made a roux first (using 1.5 tbs butter, 1.5 tbs olive oil and 3 tbs flour). I used 1 c skim milk & 1/2c heavy cream and omitted the water. It came out very creamy and rich. I served them over brown rice that i cooked in chicken broth.

This is an excellent recipe for our whole family. I doubled the amount and I’m glad I did, NO LEFTOVERS!! I followed the recipe exactly, I let the ground chicken mixture “sit” for about 2 hours after putting everything together and that made making the meatballs easy. I served it with garlic butter green beans and it was all devoured. We are a family of 5 and we all agree: 5 stars!

I was very pleased with this recipe. Meatballs were great! I needed to simmer the sauce a little more, but it was good. I will definitely try this again and take pictures. It was my first time making Zucchini spaghetti noodles and they were very good.
super yummy. I added poultry seasoning just because. the meatballs are sticky to work with. I also added cheese to the meatballs. the sauce is soooooo good. I'm putting it on everything!

When I read this recipe, I thought it would be wonderful. I followed the recipe exactly. After making it, my first bite reminded me of a cheap chicken sausage, you know- the kind which stays with you for the rest of the day. Everyone at the meal agreed.
Literally one of the best recipes for Keto Diet. Love the juicy texture of the chicken.
I made these with ground turkey and also with ground turkey. The meatballs made with ground were a better and much easier to work with! Both were good though.
Delicious, no additions necessary.
Really enjoyed the cheese sauce. The meatballs were ok, clever idea to play off of chicken cordon bleu. It was a changeup from beef meatballs.

This is a very tasty recipe as is, but if you are not going completely keto I would recommend adding some breadcrumbs to make the meatballs easier to deal with. The meatballs were very hard to shape because of how wet the meat mixture was. Other than that it was delicious.

This recipe had a great flavor and I will make it again, however I have 2 semi-cons. In preparing to cook, I first cut the ham as directed. When I started to put the chicken mixture and ham into meatballs, the idea of biting into a chunk of ham in the center did not appeal to me. I cut the ham into 1/4" cubes or so--mixed it all together and cooked them. I found I needed much more than 1T of olive oil and almost double the suggested 3 minutes on "each" side. Balls do not have "sides".
My second semi-con, I prefer my sauce a little thicker. I wondered how the sauce would thicken with no thickening ingredient. It didn't. I much prefer to have the sauce cling to the meatballs. That all said, the meatballs with the small ham cubes mixed in and accompanied by the sauce made an extremely tasty entree. I now know why there are mistakes in raters' reviews. This setup makes it impossible to go back and
 edit my review. Very annoying.
We really liked this dish. I made mine with ground turkey. I cooked the meatballs a little longer adding a small amount of the broth and covering to cook through. I will make this again.

Flavor was great..I used a higher fat content ground turkey..only issue I had was at the end with the cheese not melting to incorporate into the sauce...it ended up a stringy mess..I used block store brand cheese...to the creator...any suggestions?
Chicken meatballs were very dry.
My family loved these! I didn’t have any ground chicken, so I had to use ground turkey, but I did everything else as written. I served them with cauliflower gnocchi.

Recipe creator here! If your meatballs are dry, you are likely overcooking them, or using too lean of ground chicken. As is the norm with keto, try using a fattier blend of ground chicken, which uses dark meat (85% lean), instead of using pure ground breast meat (98% lean). As for the cheese not melting properly, I would encourage you to use a finer shred size and to only add about 1/4 cup cheese at a time, whisk to incorporate, then add more until completely added. Also, using too high heat will cause your cheese to seize up and not melt properly, so heat gently and as evenly as possible while the cheese is melting. Enjoy!
